item.title: Thoughts
item.description: This is my thought page. There are time where I just want sit down and be able to write my thoughts to share with no structure.

item.title: Streamline Converting EMR
item.description: Let’s convert all physical medical records to electronics Objective Convert and maintain EMR for local medical offices To-Do’s - Read on EMR - Electronic Medical Records - Find out how medical records are being kept - Identify some roadblocks - Extra - Read human genome project - Figure out how each patience is being tracked through this whole genome project - Are the there any open source places for medical record?

item.title: About
item.description: I am a believer and a learner. I’ve been serving as a youth leader every weekend since 2008. Through teaching our youths, studying, praying and application, I have come to find God an integral part of my life. He is the source for my energy, happiness and peace. Other things that excite me, is the world we live in. It is full of things to be learned and shared; this was made more apparent after I finished school.

item.title: Home
item.description: Welcome to my blog! Here, you’ll find posts on lessons I’ve learned, the things I find interesting, and what I am working on. Although I am not much of a writer, (really, it takes me a very long time to write together a post), it is an attempt to track my thoughts and share learnings through the years. Although my interest is wide, you will most likely find contents regarding software and hardware development on this blog.

item.title: My Useful Commands
item.description: My Useful Commands Commands Notes Nothing grep -rin "text here" . For recursive text search, that is case insensitive with line numbers Standards In/Out/Error STDIN (channel 0): Where your command draws the input from.

item.description: My To-Do’s All the things that needs to be checked of Unsorted To-do’s Install Let’s Encrypt on QNAP Write code for midicontroller Learn how to use Ansible to setup dotfiles convert tiddlywiki to markdown - https://github.com/achabotl/tiddly2md Look at Open Source Matlab – https://www.gnu.org/software/octave/ Read on EMR - Electronic Medical Records Learn how to compile a Linux Kernel Project To-Do’s - Clean up Hizzle blog and get an updated version up and running - Set up a blog for Claire to journal/track General Development Tasks - Get esp-open-sdk up and running - Successfully build it and set PATH is a clean manner [o] - Get cscope up and running with VIM and a sample esp project - Get cscope and ctags to work with gutentags - Get cscope to ignore README and tags file.

item.title: ESP8266
item.description: Frameworks There are open community versions of ESP8266, and the ones from ExpressIf ESP Open Source esp-open-sdk esp-open-rtos Using FreeRTOS in the back ESP Close source ESP8266_RTOS_SDK ESP8266_NONOS_SDK Background Methods Bare Metal with Open SDK RTOS with FreeRTOS user_init():: is in the rtos–>core. This is the entry to the system. Part of the user_start_phase2 which takes the user_init_task and then starts the scheduler.

item.title: Getting Nvidia GPU to work on Ubuntu
item.description: THIS IS THE MOST IMPORTANT ARTICLE TO READ! https://devblogs.nvidia.com/gpu-containers-runtime/ The basics of Dockers docker images - the actual file for the container, this shows all the images that have been downloaded docker containers - the instance of the images docker ps -a - list all the containers, even the ones that are stopped docker start <container-name> - will start a stopped container docker stop <container-name> - will stop a running container the --rm - argument will destroy the container as soon as it is stopped Docker compose docker-compose up - spin up a docker container using docker-compose.

item.title: Linux Standard Tools
item.description: Standard Tools Grep grep for files with lines greater than 500 chars grep -Er --include \*.h --include \*.cpp '^.{500,}' . find Moving Around Screen To start screen with a name, and detached in the background screen -dmS <screensession> <command> To attach to a screen, we’ll need to run screen -DRx <screensession> This command will detach the current screen session anywhere else, and attach it to the current terminal.

item.title: Search
item.description: This file exists solely to respond to /search URL with the related search layout template. No content shown here is rendered, all content is based in the template layouts/page/search.html Setting a very low sitemap priority will tell search engines this is not important content. This implementation uses Fusejs, jquery and mark.js Initial setup Search depends on additional output content type of JSON in config.toml ``` [outputs] home = [“HTML”, “JSON”] ```

item.title: Manjaro Linux
item.description: TO-DO set up KVM for and check out VirtualGL performance install nvidia graphic driver share home drive with QNAP same user name and permission on NAS? ANSWER is LDAP! [QNAP LDAP]](https://www.qnap.com/en/how-to/tutorial/article/how-to-use-the-built-in-ldap-server-of-qnap-nas-for-user-management/) Configuration notes sudo access by other user on the files Todo: - push local user to ldap server - set nfs mount for home drive Sync user creation from qnap to machines draw network map https://github.

item.title: Installing Linux on Pixelbook
item.description: Understanding Linux Kernel - Low level drivers that interacts with hardware Firmware Stuff Firmware Write Protect Firmware is stored on a special SPI flash chip and has a special register that sets the device to read-only. This change be changed by special hardware and software measures. The write protection of these chips are dependent on grounding a WP pin on the flash chip. Specific to chromebook models after 2017+ (CR50 models), the state of the WP pin is controlled by the CR50 with close-case debugging (CCD).

item.title: Home Renovation
item.description: [TOC] Garage Note about garage fire ‘separationj’fire separation Drywall ceiling in the garage needs to be 5/8” Type “X” So this means no return air registers or heat supply registers inside the garage. garage door To meet fire separation requirements, the door must be one of three types of doors:Â a solid wood door not less than 1-3/8 inches thick, a solid or honeycomb core steel doors not less than 1-3/8 inches thick, or a 20->minute fire-rated door, with a self-closing device.

item.title: Sainsmart RYC GRBL V2 Upgrade
item.description: GRBL has been optimized for Ardunio’s ATmega328p. So most configurations out there will use the Arduino Uno and a CNC shield. I decide to go with the Sainsmart RYC-GRBL-V2 hoping it would work out of the box. The reason why this is a long post is because it didn’t work out of the box. To get it up and running these are the list of things I changed to get it working.

item.title: Upgrading K40 Controller
item.description: K40 Laser Engraver Upgrades Add Switch to change between manual power, and PWM power add in a switch to switch between a potentiometer and the PWM power from the laser for the IN line on LPS” K40 Laser Engraver Controller Board Upgrades PiBot Raspberry Pi CNC Hat V2.60 - GRBL v1.1 Compatable - Uses Pololu Stepper Drivers Look for this 2.6V https://www.ebay.com/itm/Raspberry-Pi-CNC-Hat-V2-60-GRBL-v1-1-Compatable-Uses-Pololu-Stepper-Drivers/271901344091?hash=item3f4e95415b:g:bhsAAOSwZLZaTWn~ Smoothieboard - fork off GRBL

item.title: Shower Pan
item.description: Shower Pan Construction Material Needed Shower rough valve Framing and Plumbing Shower Pan Shower pan use packed dry mud on bottom layer 5 to 1 mixture of sand and Portland cement clay like mixture that hold its shape when packed Top mortar layer should be 1 1/2” - 2” thick at the drain Notes about different layers of mortars Thin is a recipe for failure.

item.title: Completion
item.description: Neocompelete and Deoplete are loaded on different Vim conditions. This condition can be found in plugin.yaml file. - repo: Shougo/deoplete.nvim depends: context_filetype.vim if: has('nvim') && empty($VIM_MINIMAL) on_i: 1 hook_add: let g:deoplete#enable_at_startup = 1 hook_source: source $VIMPATH/config/plugins/deoplete.vim - repo: Shougo/neocomplete depends: context_filetype.vim if: ! has('nvim') && has('lua') && empty($VIM_MINIMAL) on_event: InsertEnter hook_add: | let g:neocomplete#data_directory = $VARPATH.'/complete' let g:neocomplete#enable_at_startup = 1 hook_source: source $VIMPATH/config/plugins/neocomplete.vim As shown here, Deoplete only load when Neovim is present.

item.title: Theming
item.description: Getting Vim background to match with Tmux Use :hi to show all the colors for the current theme in vim Sync Tmux colors to sync with Vim change of colors is synced with vim. So background changes have to be done in Vim.

item.title: Initial Configs
item.description: Initial vim configurations. Played around and finally settled on Rafi’s vim-config on GitHub. It had configurations for NeoVim as well as vim, and it had all the little things I was looking for when setting up Vim initially. Checkout his configurations - https://github.com/rafi/vim-config What is Dein? and Denite? Dein is a Vim package mananger. How does it work? Reading log messages :messages will show the messages What is Deoplete Completion!

item.title: Makefiles
item.description: Definitions Rule:: explain how/when to remake certain files. What shown above is a rule. Target:: Usually name of the file that is compiled. Can also be a command (with the use of PHONY) Dependencies:: files that are used to create the target Command:: The actions that get carried out Basics Makefile Tells make how to compile and link a program Every changed source will be recompiled If header is changed, each source file containing the header will also be recompiled Any source file that has been recompiled will be saved, and linked to create a new executable Reading a Makefile Target gets defined first, the dependencies and then the commands

item.title: 2017 Portland Marathon
item.description: Preparing for the Portland Marathon started about 6 months before. I was running before the registration, but on June 7th, 2017, I made a decision to run in the marathon. I have never ran a marathon before, and never even dreamed about running it. But after running with a close friend on a frequent basis, I got exposed to a technique that helped me through the training and the marathon itself.

item.title: Simple Banking
item.description: I’m not sure about a lot of people, but I was constantly surprise by my credit card statement each month as I pay off my credit card. It is also no surprise that my savings, were really saving. When I have some extra money left over from my monthly spending, I throw in a dollar here and there just to have a saving. This was not working out. The Envelope System - Digitized Goals are set up just like evelope Set a goal and the time you want to reach it Goals: Mortage for the month Food budget Fuel budget Groceries Eating out Pet budget Emergency funds Hobby/project funds Pick a budget, set a time and fund it!

item.title: Vim Essentials
item.description: There are so many things to talk about Vim, this article is aimed to help you get you familiar with Vim by learning what the basic features and ability of Vim. After using Vim for about a year now, there are a few things I wish I knew about Vim when I first made the commitment to jump over to this ancient looking editor; let me tell you, this text editor is anything be ancient.

item.title: Flask 101
item.description: Run through this tutorials Wide range of resources http://mattupstate.com/blog/how-i-structure-my-flask-applications/ https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-structure-large-flask-applications https://www.fullstackpython.com/flask.html http://igordavydenko.com/talks/dneprpy-2/#slide-2 “Microframework for Python” Extensions Extensions in Flask is named Flask_ There are a couple of ways that the extension can be initiated Simple Method This simple method initiate the extension with the flask core app. the extension is exposed and can be used with others. # settings.py SQLALCHEMY_SCHEMA_URI = 'postgresql://username:password@host:port/database' # app.py from flask import Flask from flask.

item.title: SSL Protocol
item.description: Introduction Encryption use cryptographic pair, composed of a key and a certificate. Root pair is a cryptographic pair that is used to sign intermediates CAs. Handshake SSL handshake uses asymmetric encryption first, then symmetric encryption after. Reason being, symmetric encryption is a lot faster. Client Action Server ‘Hello, these are encryption protocol I support…’ => - - <= 'Hello, let’s use ___ protocol.

item.title: code-snippets
item.description: plink.exe tunnel-home -N -ssh -2 -P 2223 -l "root" -C -i "C:\.ssh\MyEnTunnel\keyfile.ppk" -v Markdown ![]() allows you to upload images to ghost Python Useful design patterns for Python: Link GIT Some help snippet from gist Workflow Helpful site for the GIT workflow: here Successful git branching model: here Settings Keep branch history from flatten, use --no-ff while merge or set git config --global merge.ff false <- remember admin access is needed

item.title: SQL Basics
item.description: Introduction Relational databases are made from tables SQL Standards Code and Jargon Notes ; terminator and can be optional for some Dialects. also use as separator CAP vs cap SQL is not case sensitive. But to be portable, use ‘CAP’ CODE here; -- comment here More recent SQL systems allow for “c-style” commenting /* comment */ for multiline Clauses are bite size code of a statement SELECT * FROM table -> clause 1; WHERE condition -> clause 2; Functions -> eg.

item.title: Starting NodeJS
item.description: What is node Up and Running A new key distinctions nvm - Node version manager node - this is the main node engine npm - node package manager ~/.npmrc - configuration changes from global These three items are key to keeping a node environment together! It should be ‘noded’ (lol), that there is a reason why nvm was created in the first place. This may be because the node engine changes from one revision to the next so often that manager is needed.

item.title: Git Workflow
item.description: Merging vs. Rebasing The two essentially do the same thing. the difference is that rebase makes the history linear. This is good when you are developing on your own branches, but not good when we you working on public branch, more here To merge or rebase master into a feature git checkout feature git merge master # or.. a oneliner git merge master feature # say it in your head, git merge master into feature Rewriting history keeping a clean history is important This code snippets will allow you to interactively update commits for a particular branch.

item.title: Linux Essentials
item.description: Linux Filesystem You got your swap, root and home partitions swap - space on the hard drive use for virtual memory root - LVM - Logical Volume Management Setting up system for backup and imaging - wiki Create a snapshot of the current logical volume sudo lvcreate --size 10G -s -n p_nodered /dev/ubuntu-vg/root Do any modification to the filesystem If everything works as expected, remove the snapshot. Keeping it from growing!

item.title: Upgrade K8200 Controller Board
item.description: I realized it takes a very long time for the heated-bed to get up to temperature and start printing. This was one of the main reason why I did not use it as often as I originally intended. With a slew of difficulties, e.g. Z-wobble and first layer not adhering to the board. The K8200 soon became a project of it’s own. In short, this is the start to making the K8200 be usable, as an everyday tool.

item.title: Learning SSH
item.description: What is SSH It is probably one of the most useful tools I have come to learn. Secure Shell is a protocol that allows data to be transferred securely between client and server. Typically, the client (typically is you) to log onto a server (another computer) remotely. uses a pair of private and public keys. These keys can be generated by a SSH key generator. There are different levels of security.

item.title: 40 Years, Try 40 Hours
item.description: Just this past weekend, our youth group finished a camping trip. The camp was given a name, ‘Survival In Christ’. The theme is based off of the Book of Exodus and the 40 years that the Israelites spent in the desert. It was ironic how the Israelites spent 40 years in the desert, and we spent 40 hours in the hot summer sun. Through these 40 hours, there were blood, sweat and tear, literally.
